API Journey - Level 3

Core Functionality (_journey/deployment/serverless/core-functionality/index.md) (3/1) - Running scripts in a variety of programming languages individually as the backend for each services API path.

Content Harvesting & Extraction (_journey/deployment/scraping/content-harvesting-&-extraction/index.md) (3/1) - Defining how content and data will be harvested and extracting consistently across scraping operations.

Common Connectors (_journey/deployment/connector/common-connectors/index.md) (3/1) - Some of the most common connections for taking existing backend resources and turning them into APIs, often times without having to write code, and something that non-developers can do.

REST API Frameworks (_journey/deployment/frameworks/rest-api-frameworks/index.md) (3/1) - Providing a robust list of API frameworks for deploying REST API services, providing a common framework that leverages the web for making services available.

3rd Party Connectors (_journey/deployment/connector/3rd-party-connectors/index.md) (3/2) - Providing a list of all the 3rd party connectors that are available and enable the deploying of APIs from existing services that are being consumed outside the firewall. Providing a common way to abstract away the service and make available as part of service stacks.

GraphQL API Frameworks (_journey/deployment/frameworks/graphql-api-frameworks/index.md) (3/2) - Providing a robust list of API frameworks for deploying GraphQL API services, providing a common framework for delivering the API while also providing a query language layer on top of all services.

Crawling (_journey/deployment/scraping/crawling/index.md) (3/2) - Establishing common practices for crawling of websites for discovery and targeting of content for consumption via scraping processes.

Availability (_journey/deployment/serverless/availability/index.md) (3/2) - Dialing in the performance and availability of each serverless script or function allowing them to behave differently depending on the type of service it is driving.

Frameworks (_journey/deployment/serverless/frameworks/index.md) (3/3) - Some of the open source frameworks available for deploying of serverless solutions, for a variety of use cases.

Content Storage & Access (_journey/deployment/scraping/content-storage-&-access/index.md) (3/3) - Defining how scraped content is organized as part of a wider scraping and harvesting workflow intending to get needed resources for making available via APIs.

gRPC API Frameworks (_journey/deployment/frameworks/grpc-api-frameworks/index.md) (3/3) - Providing a robust list of API frameworks for deploying gRPC API services, providing a common framework for delivering the API while increasing efficiency, performance, and leveraging HTTP/2 as a transport.

Automation & Orchestration (_journey/deployment/scraping/automation-&-orchestration/index.md) (3/4) - Allowing for the automation and orchestration of the scraping process enabling it to be scaled, and automated to the needs of services.

DNS (_journey/deployment/scraping/dns/index.md) (3/5) - Allowing for the management of DNS associated with scraping, allowing for domains to be efficiently targeted, and excluded depending on what is needed.

Document Processing (_journey/deployment/scraping/document-processing/index.md) (3/6) - Enabling the process of common types of documents for storing content and data, allowing the scripting to process contained documentations and make available via APIs.

Integrations (_journey/deployment/scraping/integrations/index.md) (3/7) - Organizing a master list of 3rd party integrations available as part of the scraping services and tooling, allowing it to be further refined, processed, and made available across the lifecycle.

International (_journey/deployment/scraping/international/index.md) (3/8) - Making the scraping process as flexible as possible when it comes to identifying languages, and adjusting to different geographic regions being targeted.

Machine Learning (_journey/deployment/scraping/machine-learning/index.md) (3/9) - Defining what type of machine learning resources can be applied as part of the scraping process, building in intelligence and evolving how scraping of data and content occurs.

Media Acquisition (_journey/deployment/scraping/media-acquisition/index.md) (3/10) - Enabling scraping operations to be able to target and work with a variety of media objects, allowing them to be able to work with a variety of content sources, and make sense of many formats.

Structured Data Extraction (_journey/deployment/scraping/structured-data-extraction/index.md) (3/11) - Being able to work with structured data as part of the extraction process, making sure that data is consumed in the most meaningful and efficient way as possible.

Utilities (_journey/deployment/scraping/utilities/index.md) (3/12) - Some other scraping items that will contribute to being able to effectively scrape and harvest content from across the web, for use in deploying services.

Analytics (_journey/deployment/scraping/analytics/index.md) (3/13) - Providing a set of analytics for the scraping and harvesting process, allowing for domains, and other aspects of the process, ensuring the effectiveness of activity, and ingesting the highest quality sources as possible.
